TopicTitle: Is making a science mod that can add more science part a good idea ?

Articles.Content: There are not much science parts in KSP1,  so adding some more parts in it might can be better. I'm working on the Mod, but I don't know other kerbin's idea. Can you guys help?
would be cool with like a srface scanner that you woulld have to travel a certain distance to scan everything. would add reasons to use a plane or a rover.

To create science points? That would offset the balance that the devs brought into the game (one can have a discussion on how good that balance is but I digress). The current system really forces players to explore beyond their comfortable boundaries. Most players don't go beyond Minmus and KSP2's mission system is kind of enforcing that with its lack of significant science points to be ground out.

Now, having said that, I think there is plenty of room to create instruments for those that want to do real science—the KSP1 parts like a thermometer, barometer, accelerometer,etc. The physical properties are there, so why not make parts that can measure them? Perhaps even with a log function to store to a text file, so you can plot temperature and pressure against altitude.

It would b a fantastic idea as there is a large group of players who misses those kind of instruments and go out and measure things. If there ever is going to be an educational version of KSP2 it would also support that.
IMHO the only science part I miss is an asteroid sample collector for probes. Considering there are elaborated ESA missions this is a bummer. Otherwise more science = more tedious clicking.
We could use a Snackulizer™ - to scan for and give readings for snacks and/or snack-like substances.

Many mods add parts and experiments. Take a look at DMagic Orbital Science and SCANSat for some ideas. Also 2 great and extensive parts mods that have a few science parts: Tantares and BDB.
You can Try to Probeplus mod, the mod adds a lot of  Scientific equipment
